intro: Gronophyllum ramsayi, commonly known as the Ramsey's ironwood, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, hard, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It is well adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal and inland fynbos vegetation. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
